cab.content: (THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HER BRITANNIC MAJESTY^GOVERNMENT)secret.(52) 298 COPY NO11TH SEPTEMBER, 1952CABINETCONSTITUTIONAL REFORM IN HONG Kong memorandum by the Secretary of State for the colonies regret having to trouble the Cabinet again with this matter.My colleagues will remember that on the 20th May, 1952, theCabinet approved of my proceeding with the measure of constitutional Reform proposed in C. (52) 165 (C. C. (52) 54th Conclusions,Minute 6).2. When the Governor of Hong Kong arrived in this country on leave I discussed the matter further with him. I do not propose to proceed with these reforms until conditions are more settled.O.L,Colonial Office, S.W.1.11TH SEPTEMBER, 1952.
